discussion.content:
agreed ACD. 
To set up a Lightning web component as a quick action on a record page, define the metadata in <component>.js-meta.xml. Define a lightning__RecordAction target and specify actionType as ScreenAction for a screen action that opens in a window or Action for a headless action that executes when clicked. Here’s the configuration for a headless action.

questions.question_text:
A developer is asked to create a Lightning web component that will be invoked via a button on a record page. The component must be displayed in a modal dialog.

Which three steps should the developer take to achieve this? (Choose three.)

choices.B: Use a dynamic form on the customer record page to display recent interactions.
choices.C: Use batch Apex to query for the most recent interactions when the customer view screen is loaded.
choices.D: Use Lightning Flow to read the customer's record type, and then do a dynamic query for recent interactions and display on the View page.
choices.A: Use a Lightning component to query and display interactions based on record type that is passed in using a design:attribute from the Lightning page.

questions.question_text:
When the sales team views an individual customer record, they need to see recent interactions for the customer. These interactions can be sales, orders, phone calls, or Cases. The date range for recent interactions will be different for every customer record type.

How can this be accomplished?

choices.B: Merge on the Order__c object and specify the ERP_Customer_ID__c for the Account relationship.
choices.A: Insert on the Order__c object followed by an update on the Order__c object.
choices.D: Upsert on the Account and specify the ERP_Customer_ID__c for the relationship.
choices.C: Upsert on the Order__c object and specify the ERP_Customer_ID__c for the Account relationship.

questions.question_text:

What should the integration use to create new Order__c records that will automatically be related to the correct Account?

discussion.content:

questions.question_text:
A developer writes a Lightning web component that displays a dropdown list of all custom objects in the org from which a user will select. An Apex method prepares and returns data to the component.

What should the developer do to determine which objects to include in the response?

choices.A: Check the getObiectType() value for ‘Custom’ or ‘Standard’ on the sObject describe result.
choices.C: Use the getCustomObjects() method from the Schema class.
choices.B: Import the list of all custom objects from @salesforce/schema.
choices.D: Check the isCustom() value on the sObject describe result.
